title: el_gado
body:
An antagonist videogame character from [[Capcom]].

He first appeared in the [[Final Fight]] game from the 80s, and in many other fighting games since then. The first and only playable appearance of this character was in the game [i]Final Fight Revenge[/i].

[b]El Gado[/b] is part of the original [[Mad Gear]] gang that terrorized the streets of [[Metro City]]. He sports a beard and wears a greenish-yellow military outfit. He is of Arabic origin, and his fighting style is Souo-katsuken (Double Scorpion Tail technique). 

He works directly for [[Rolento]], along with [[Holly Wood]] (his palette-swap), [[Axl (Final Fight)|]] and Slash. They are the primary foot soldiers in Rolento's "army", all trained by Rolento himself. 

Both El Gado and Holly Wood are [[knife]]-wielding enemies who wear military style costumes, known for their agile movements which they forged by dancing. They have a special technique known as the "Jumping Knife Attack". These two also appeared in [[Street Fighter Zero (series)|]] 3 as part of Rolento's special techniques and win poses.

title: australia
body:
[b]Australia[/b], officially known as [b]The Commonwealth of Australia[/b], is a country comprising the mainland of the Australian continent, the island of Tasmania, and numerous smaller islands located all in Oceania. 

It is the world's sixth-largest country by total area. Neighbouring countries include [[Indonesia]], East Timor and Papua New Guinea to the north; the Solomon Islands, Vanuatu and New Caledonia to the north-east; and [[New Zealand]] to the south-east.

title: shellos
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #422 in the National PokéDex, a Water type Pokémon.
Its form depends on where its found.

* [[Shellos (West)]]: The underside is white and its shell is pink. The shell has several small spike-like protrusions on it. On its head is a ring of pink fleshy knobs resembling flower petals that spike up.
* [[Shellos (East)]]: The underside is green and its shell is blue. The shell has two flap-like protrusions. These flaps are lined in yellow. On its head are two white-tipped knobs resembling horns that extend away from its face.

It evolves into [[Gastrodon]].
Japanese Name: [b]Karakanushi[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Cherrim]]
Next Pokémon: [[Gastrodon]]

title: zweilous
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #634 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Dark/Dragon Pokémon.
Zweilous is a dark-blue, quadruped Pokémon with two heads and black fur covering its necks and back. Its front legs are muscular with two claws on each foot, but its rear legs are less defined and have two small, backward-pointing toes without claws. There are tufts of fur over its heads with rounded points at the top. It has two thin wings on its back, each ending in two points. The fur stops at the chest and opens up to fuchsia striped bands on the side of its legs. Though it appears to lack eyes, it is unknown if Zweilous is blind.

It evolves from [[Deino (Pokemon)|]] starting at level 50. It then evolves into Hydreigon starting at level 64. 
Japanese Name: [b]Dihead[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[deino_(pokemon)|Deino]]
Next Pokémon: [[Hydreigon]]

title: deino_(pokemon)
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #633 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Dark/Dragon Pokémon.
Deino is a small blue quadrupedal Pokémon with black fur covering its head and neck, concealing everything but its mouth from view. The fur around its neck also has six purple spots encircling it, which resemble bruises. The hair on the top of its head takes the shape of a single small horn. It also has a short tail that appears to be bitten off. As it is blind, it will bite at and eat anything that moves, and it has the vigor and energy to bite constantly and without stopping.

It evolves into [[Zweilous]] starting at level 50. Zweilous then evolves into [[Hydreigon]] starting at level 64.
Japanese Name: [b]Monozu[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Durant]]
Next Pokémon: [[Zweilous]]

title: cubchoo
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #613 in the National PokéDex, an Ice type Pokémon.
Cubchoo is a bipedal, ursine Pokémon with a light blue head and neck. It has a slightly pointed head with large round ears, shiny, dark, oval eyes, and a darker blue muzzle. Cubchoo has a shiny dark nose, from which a considerable amount of light blue nasal mucus — the source of its attacks — droops. The lower part of its body is white. It has rounded forepaws, digit-less feet with black paw pads, and a small round tail. 

It evolves into [[Beartic]] starting at Level 37.
Cubchoo's nose is constantly running.
Japanese name: [b]Kumasyun[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Haxorus]]
Next Pokémon: [[Beartic]]

title: lampent
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #608 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Fire/Ghost Pokémon.
Lampent has a clear, spherical head containing a bluish purple flame and oval, yellow eyes. On top of its head is a black covering, which resembles a lampshade, with a pointed spike on top. Underneath its head is a small, black body with a pointed spike at the bottom. Extending from its body are two long, wavy arms with no fingers. It floats through the air to move.

It evolves from [[Litwick]] and evolves into [[Chandelure]] with a [i]Dusk Stone[/i].
Japanese Name: [b]Lampler[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Litwick]]
Next Pokémon: [[Chandelure]]

title: klink
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #599 in the National PokéDex, a Steel type Pokémon.
Klink resembles two interlocking gears with six teeth each. The teeth of the gears are a light gray, with a darker central region. Each gear has a white "X" in place of its left eye, while their right eyes have a black pupil and white sclera. They have round turquoise noses and small mouths. Klink can launch itself at opponents in the form of [i]Gear Grind[/i] and [i]Shift Gear[/i], its "signature moves":http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Signature_move. 

It evolves into [[Klang]].
Japanese Name: [b]Giaru[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Ferrothorn]]
Next Pokémon: [[Klang]]

title: boldore
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #525 in the National PokéDex, a Rock type Pokémon.
Boldore is a blue rock-like Pokémon with an array of red crystals on its back and front, and a spine protruding from between its yellow ears. Rocky chunks at its sides comprise pincer-like limbs, tipped with red crystals similar to the ones on its back. 

It evolves from [[Roggenrola]] and when traded into [[Gigalith]].
Japanese Name: [b]Gantle[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Roggenrola]]
Next Pokémon: [[Gigalith]]

title: purrloin
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #509 in the National PokéDex, a Dark type Pokémon.
Purrloin is a primarily purple, feline Pokémon. Its head has tufted fur on its ears and cheeks. There are long, tapered violet markings above its green, eyes.

It evolves into [[Liepard]].
Japanese Name: [b]Choroneko[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Stoutland]]
Next Pokémon: [[Liepard]]

title: diancie
body:
[[Pokemon]] #719 in the National PokéDex, a dual-type Rock/Fairy Mythical Pokémon.

It can [[mega pokemon|Mega Evolve]] into [[Mega Diancie]] using the [i]Diancite[/i].

Prior Pokémon: [[Zygarde]]
Next Pokémon: [[Hoopa]]

title: mesprit
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #481 in the National PokéDex, a Psychic type Legendary Pokémon.
Mesprit is a small, gray, fairy-like Pokémon. It has two tails that each have a red jewel encrusted in them. These are, presumably, two of the jewels which comprise the "Red Chain":http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Red_Chain. Mesprit has a partially magenta face with four long, drooping appendages and another red gem encrusted in its forehead.

With [[Uxie]] and [[Azelf]] is is part of the "Lake Guardians":http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Lake_guardians in Sinnoh. 
It is the bringer of emotion.

Japanese Name: [b]Emrit[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Uxie]]
Next Pokémon: [[Azelf]]

title: gliscor
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #472 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Ground/Flying Pokémon.
Gliscor is a large, mainly blue-purple vampire bat-like Pokémon. Its legs have two toes and a slightly darker circular coloration on the underside, and its tail has two barbs, giving its tail the resemblance of a vampire's fangs.

It evolves from [[Gligar]] when leveled up holding a [i]Razor Fang[/i]. 
Japanese Name: [b]Glion[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Glaceon]]
Next Pokémon: [[Mamoswine]]

title: monferno
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #391 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Fire/Fighting Pokémon.
Monferno is a bipedal, primate-like Pokémon. Orange fur covers most of its body, except for its ears, muzzle, fingers, circular areas on its palms, feet, and chest, which are tan.

It evolves from [[Chimchar]] and evolves into [[Infernape]].
Japanese Name: [b]Moukazaru[/b]

[b]See also:[/b]
[[Grotle]]
[[Prinplup]]


Prior Pokémon: [[Chimchar]]
Next Pokémon: [[Infernape]]

title: chingling
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #433 in the National PokéDex, a Psychic type Pokémon.
Chingling is a yellow, spherical Pokémon similar to a bell. It has stubby arms and legs, as well as beady, black eyes.

It evolves into [[Chimecho]] when leveled up during the night.
Japanese Name: [b]Lisyan[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Purugly]]
Next Pokémon: [[Stunky]]

title: purugly
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #432 in the National PokéDex, a Normal type Pokémon.
Purugly is a rotund gray and white feline Pokémon with a crescent-shaped head. Its ears are pointed and tipped purple. It has whiskers with a zigzag-like pattern at the end of them.

It evolves from [[Glameow]].
Japanese Name: [b]Bunyatto[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Glameow]]
Next Pokémon: [[Chingling]]

title: dusclops
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #356 in the National PokéDex, a Ghost type Pokémon.
Dusclops has a roundish gray body with two stubby legs. Its body is hollow and can absorb anything much like a black hole. It has single red eye and three tooth-like projections.

It evolves from [[Duskull]] and evolves into [[Dusknoir]] when traded holding the [i]Reaper Cloth[/i].
Japanese Name: [b]Samayouru[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Duskull]]
Next Pokémon: [[Tropius]]

title: seviper
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #336 in the National PokéDex, a Poison type Pokémon. Seviper is a serpentine Pokémon that is usually depicted scrunched up like an accordion. It is mostly black, but has several markings on its body. It is in a feud with [[Zangoose]].

Japanese Name: [b]Habunake[/b]

Prior Pokemon: [[Zangoose]]
Next Pokémon: [[Lunatone]]

title: grumpig
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #326 in the National PokéDex, a Psychic type Pokémon.
Grumpig is a bipedal, pig-like Pokémon. It has large ears, a pink snout, and oval eyes.

It evolves from [[Spoink]]
Japanese Name: [b]Boopig[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Spoink]]
Next Pokémon: [[Spinda]]

title: camerupt
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #323 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Fire/Ground Pokémon.
Camerupt is a quadruped Pokémon that resembles a "Bactrian camel":https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bactrian_camel. It has two gray volcanoes on its back. 

It evolves from [[Numel]] and with the [i]Cameruptite[/i] it can [[mega pokemon|mega evolve]] into [[Mega Camerupt]].
Japanese Name: [b]Bakuuda[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Numel]]
Next Pokémon: [[Torkoal]]

title: pelipper
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #279 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Water/Flying Pokémon.
Pelipper is a pelican-like Pokémon whose head and bill make up the majority of its body. 

It evolves from [[Wingull]]

Japanese Name: [b]Pelipper[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Wingull]]
Next Pokémon: [[Ralts]]

It evolves from [[Scyther]] when traded holding a [i]metal coat[/i] and with the [i]Scizorite[/i] it can [[mega pokemon|mega evolve]] into [[Mega Scizor]].

Japanese Name: [b]Hassam[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Qwilfish]]

title: gyarados
body:
Pokémon #130 in the National Pokédex.

A giant, draconic serpent, its body is accented with spiked fins, its massive maw with viscious fangs and thin, drawn whiskers, and its forehead with a tri-point crest.

Evolves from [[Magikarp]] and with the [i]Gyaradosite[/i] it can [[mega pokemon|mega evolve]] into [[Mega Gyarados]].

Japanese name: Gyarados

Prior Pokémon: [[Magikarp]]
Next Pokémon: [[Lapras]]

Next Pokémon: [[Tauros]]

title: gengar
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #094 in the National Pokédex.

A solid, spikey, shadowy form with stubby arms and legs, red eyes, and a sinister toothed smile.

Evolves from [[Haunter]] (from [[Gastly]]) and with the [i]Gengarite[/i] it can mega evolve into [[Mega Gengar]].

Certain Gengar can [[Gigantamax]] into [[Gigantamax Gengar]].

Japanese name: [b]Gangar[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Haunter]]
Next Pokémon: [[Onix]]

title: houndoom
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #229 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Fire/Dark Pokémon.

Japanese Name: [b]Hellgar[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Houndour]]

body:

title: yanmega
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #469 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Bug/Flying Pokémon.
Yanmega is a large, dark green dragonfly Pokémon. Its large eyes are red with black lines that make a sideways "T" shape in each one. It has two large, white fangs or mandibles next to its small mouth.

It evolves from [[Yanma]] when leveled up knowing the move [i]Ancient Power[/i].
Japanese Name: [b]Megayanma[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Togekiss]]
Next Pokémon: [[Leafeon]]

title: kito_koruta
body:
Name: 岐兎こるた (Kito Koruta, the reading of 岐兎 as Kito is stated on their Pixiv page)

Joint artist account of [[koruta_(nekoimo)|Koruta]] and [[kito_(kito2)|Kito]]

These artists merged their Pixiv and Twitter accounts in January 2020. As of April 2020 each artist still has Twitter, Nicovideo and Pawoo accounts in their own name, but most posts are made on the joint accounts. New uploads should use this tag.

body:
Artist name: こるた (Koruta)

As of April 2020, while Koruta still possesses Twitter, Nicovideo and Pawoo accounts in their own name, most posts are made on the joint Pixiv and Twitter accounts: see the new [[Kito Koruta]] joint artist tag.

body:
[b]XM-X1 Crossbone Gundam X-1 Full Cloth[/b]
A further enhancement of the [[Crossbone Gundam X-1]] after the "Skull Heart" modification. The Full Cloth additional package, made with everything the SNRI had left once it became clear that maintaining the Crossbones was no longer possible, added multiple armor plates equipped with thrusters all over the unit, as well as the Skull Head Units containing I-Field generators for maximum defense. It was piloted by [[Tobia Arronax]], the former pilot of the [[Crossbone Gundam X-3]], whose wild and aggressive fighting style fit the mighty Full Cloth perfectly.
other_names: クロスボーンガンダムX-1フルクロス

title: graze_ein
body:
[b]EB-AX2 Graze Ein[/b]
A large MS developed by Gjallarhorn. It was intended to work as a testbed for the Alaya-Vijnana System, which required that the human brain recognize the suit's body as its own. It was piloted by [spoiler]the remains of [[Ein Dalton]] after his body was damaged beyond repair.[/spoiler]

[spoiler]While the machine's performance allowed for Ein to take his revenge against Tekkadan, the real goal was to allow for the Alaya-Vijnana System to be used by anyone and without the recoil damage to the brain. This new version, dubbed the Type E, would be used by [[Gaelio Bauduin]] and [[McGillis Fareed]] in the wake of Ein's defeat.[/spoiler]

title: gundam_barbatos_lupus
body:
[b]ASW-G-08 Gundam Barbatos Lupus[/b]
A comprehensive overhaul of the [[Gundam Barbatos]] after the immense damage it sustained in the fight against the [[Graze Ein]]. Its arms were lengthened, legs made more powerful, and the control system was fine-tuned to fit its pilot, [[Mikazuki Augus]].

title: captive_bead_ring
body:
A captive bead ring (ball closure ring) is a type of body [[piercing]] jewelry. The captive bead or ball fits into a small opening in the circle of the ring. The bead is slightly larger than this opening and has small indentations or depressions that correspond to the ring's end-points so that it may fit snugly against them, thus completing the circuit of the ring. Often, a hole is drilled through the bead to allow easier fitting.

Captive bead rings can also have little accessories. 

h4. Examples

* post #2584256
* post #2562182
* post #2439346

h4. See also

* [[barbell piercing]]
* [[nipple rings]]
* [[piercing]]
* [[Tag group:Piercings]]

h4. External links

* "Wikipedia: Captive bead ring":[https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Captive_bead_ring]

title: aka-san_to_kyuuketsuki
body:
A hentai visual novel.

Story summary from https://vndb.org/v12982 : 

"It was an odd time for Yuu to transfer to Niiyatomori Gakuen. Other than being able to fall fast asleep anywhere, he’s a pretty normal guy. Within half a month, he had made three friends. Shuugetsu is smart, handsome and a model student… if he could just keep his mouth shut. Shuugetsu’s osananajimi Kamui is an active girl who looks like a cool beauty… except she turns awfully delusional at the sight of anything cute. The long black-haired student council president Konoha is perfect in every way… until at important moments when extreme nervousness takes over.

The four of them are the only members of a dormitory within the school premises, which will be closed down for reasons relating to the declining birthrate. One day, a new transfer student and dorm mate arrived. The blond-haired Alexandra and her maid Ingot said they came to Japan to study meteorology, but she has a secret. Then one day, they found a child left behind in front of the dormitory."

title: burmy
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #412 in the National PokéDex, a Bug type Pokémon.

Burmy is a small, larval Pokémon with a black segmented body and a coiled antenna on top of its head.

It changes its cloak based on the location where it last battled:

* [[Burmy (Plant)]] if it last battled outside or in tall grass.
* [[Burmy (Sandy)]] if it last battled in a cave, on a beach, or faced a Pokémon from a Honey tree.
* [[Burmy (Trash)]] if it last battled in a building.

It evolves into [[Wormadam]] (if female) or into [[Mothim]] (if male).

Japanese Name: [b]Mimomucchi[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Bastiodon]]
Next Pokémon: [[Wormadam]]

h4. External links

* "Bulbapedia: Burmy (Pokémon)":[http://bulbapedia.bulbagarden.net/wiki/Burmy_(Pokémon)]

title: rickenbacker_325
body:
Semi-hollow [[electric guitar]] built by American [[instrument]] maker [[Rickenbacker]] in 1958 as the first model in the then-named "Capri" series of guitars, subsequently named the "300" series. The biggest factor in its rise to popularity was its extensive use by [[The Beatles]]' [[John Lennon]] during their early years, despite its lower commercial performance compared to the [[Rickenbacker 330]], the [[guitar]] holds a strong cult following.

Its key visual traits include:
* Factory-default triple pickup setup with a vibrato bridge
* More asymmetrical and edgier cutaway design compared to its closest sibling the 330.
* Despite being a semi-hollow guitar, the majority of models feature a solid body top making it reminiscent of a solid guitar, this is due to Lennon's version being the most popular of the 325 versions (Lennon's model was within the very first group to be produced, which feature the pre-production top).

title: rickenbacker_4001
body:
[[Bass guitar]] made by American [[instrument]] company [[Rickenbacker]] in 1961, serving a period of twenty years before being discontinued in 1981 in favour of the updated 4003 version. Despite not selling as well as the [[Rickenbacker 330]], the 4001 has risen to arguably become Rickenbacker's most popular model in its history while also being one of the standard bass choices in progressive and classic rock as well as important blips in the post-punk and metal scene.

Its key visual traits are:
* Round and curvy body design with long a asymmetrical cutaway on one side.
* Iconic "crested-wave" headstock
* Differently sized pickups with a large bridge pickup encased in a chromed plate.
* Unusual bridge.

Despite being an updated version, the 4003 model features little to no differences to the untrained eye making it almost identical to the first release of the bass.

[[FLCL]]'s [[Haruhara Haruko]] is the most well known character in Japanese media who uses a 4001, often used as a [[weapon]], a [[baseball bat]], spcifically.

title: rickenbacker
body:
An American [[instrument]] company founded in 1932, largely credited for being the world's first [[electric guitar]] maker. They specialize on the [[guitar]] and [[bass guitar]].

Their instruments are instantly recognizable by their curvy and slick designs often with sunburst colors and white accents reminiscent of road cars from the 50's and 60's.
Despite the [[Rickenbacker 330]] guitar being much more successful commercially, their most popular model is the [[Rickenbacker 4001]] bass.

[[FLCL]]'s [[Haruhara Haruko]] famously uses a 4001 as a [[weapon]].

h4. See also

title: magical_musket
body:
[[Tomoe Mami]]'s long-barreled [[gun]] from [[Mahou Shoujo Madoka Magica]].

This tag is for images sufficiently similar to the canon weapon in the anime ("sketch":[https://i.imgur.com/LIgws.jpg], post #797684). Some artists deviate from the original design, make modifications, or replace the weapon entirely. When this tag seems inappropriate, use [[rifle]] for long-barreled guns or with rifled bores, or [[musket]] if it resembles a musket and has a smooth bore. If it looks like a rifled musket, then use both [[rifle]] and [[musket]]. 

If the firing mechanism of the gun looks like a [[flintlock]], then add this tag as well. However, avoid this tag as much as possible especially if you are unfamiliar with different gunlocks. 

h4. See also 

* [[Tomoe Mami]] 
* [[Tiro Finale]] 

h4. External links

* "Nicopedia: Magical musket":http://dic.nicovideo.jp/id/4554365

title: no_name_(keyblade)
body: The No Name, also known as [[Master Xehanort]]'s [[Keyblade]] (マスター・ゼアノートのキーブレード Masutā Zeanōto no Kīburēdo?) and The Gazing Eye (見つめる目 Mitsumeru Me?), is the default form of Luxu's Keyblade that appears in Kingdom Hearts Birth by Sleep, Kingdom Hearts 3D: Dream Drop Distance, Kingdom Hearts χ, and Kingdom Hearts III. It was handed down over time, becoming the most ancient surviving Keyblade, and eventually came into the possession of Xehanort, who continued to wield it when he became [[Terra-Xehanort]]. A digital simulation of the Keyblade is wielded by No Heart, the Mirage Arena simulation of Xehanort. It is also utilized by the replica incarnation of Terra-Xehanort.

title: x-blade
body: The χ-blade is a legendary weapon introduced in [[Kingdom Hearts Birth by Sleep]]. It is the original after which all [[Keyblade]]s are imperfectly modeled from. Rather than being a man-made key to an artificial Kingdom Hearts, like the Keyblade of heart, it coexists with the true Kingdom Hearts itself, a perfect union of all hearts and worlds, and is the only thing that can summon its door. [[Xehanort]]'s Report VII According to legend, the Keyblade War occurred because of the many souls who desired to take the χ-blade and Kingdom Hearts for themselves, and [[Master Xehanort]] later enacts his plots with the same goal in mind.

title: pyroar
body:
[[Pokemon]] #668 in the National PokéDex, a dual-type Fire/Normal Pokémon. 

It evolves from [[Litleo]] starting at level 35. 

Pyroar is a quadruped, leonine Pokémon. It is mostly dark brown with light brown legs, tail tip, chest, and face. Pyroar's irises are tinted azure with black pupils.

Genders:

* [[Pyroar (male)]] - A male Pyroar has a large, dominantly red mane with gold streaks forming pattern resembling the Daimonji symbol 大. The shape also resembles the symbol for fire 火. 
* [[Pyroar (female)]] - A female Pyroar has a long, gold and red mane extending from its forehead to the whole length of its body.

Japanese Name: [b]Kaenjishi[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Litleo]]
Next Pokémon: [[Flabebe]]

title: rei_no_serafuku
body:
A [[sleeveless]] [[microdress]], visually similar to a [[serafuku]], that is completely open in the front, with [[cross-laced clothes|cross-laces]] connecting the two sides of the "shirt". The "skirt" appears to be a [[microskirt]], but as the "skirt" and "shirt" are actually a single article of clothing, it is actually a [[microdress]].

The outfit also includes [[wrist cuffs]] and a [[choker]]. Common, but not universal, elements of the outfit include [[thighhighs]], [[white panties]], and a generally blue or purple color scheme.

h4. See also

* [[meme attire]]

title: su-cool
body:
Su-cool is short for Sunao Cool, and is a character type like [[tsundere]] originating from Futaba's rakubaki-ban board: http://up.2chan.net/q/futaba.htm. The first su-cool image is post #32726 by [[Komiya (c-ko)]].

Su-cool girls are blunt and rarely get emotional. They confess their love early, in public if need be, and remain cool-headed, never blushing or displaying embarassment.

Artwork featuring su-cool girls usually feature an unambiguous love confession.

title: metro2033
body:
Metro 2033 is a post apocalyptic novel written by Dmitry Glukhovsky. It takes place in the year 2033, 20 years after fire rained down from the heavens and forced the citizens of Moscow underground. It follows Artyom, a dweller of VDNKh who leaves his station in hopes to get Polis. A man named Hunter gave him the mission in case Hunter failed. It is explained that if Artyom can get to Polis then he can find people to help his station combat the Dark Ones. They’re a new threat to the Metro, and could wipe humans off the Earth if not stopped. 

Metro 2033 was originally a Russian novel, so there are a few grammar and spelling mistakes.

Namesake is likely "20th Century Boy", a song by the British band T. Rex, released as a single in 1973 with "Free Angel" as the B-side.

[b]Project Winter[/b] is an 8 person multiplayer survival [[video game]] produced by Other Ocean Interactive.

title: barbatos_goetia
body: A major antagonist in [[Tales of Destiny 2]] who was erased from history for his cruelty and inhumanity towards others. He joins [[Elraine (Tales)|Elraine]] so he can rewrite history and validate his existence. He has become a very popular villain in the Tales series for his absurd strength and for punishing players if they use items or play on the easiest difficulty. His seiyuu is [[Wakamoto Norio]].

title: luke_(slayers)
body:
A young man who appears with [[Milina (Slayers)|Milina]] in books 9-15 of the [[Slayers]] novels. Luke is an impulsive and passionate swordsman who always shows affection for Milina, even though she ignores him. He always argues with the equally hotheaded [[Lina Inverse]].

[spoiler]Luke has a fragment of Shabranigdo within him, which is revived when Milina is killed and Luke grows enraged.[/spoiler]

title: milina_(slayers)
body:
A girl who appears in volumes 9-15 of the [[Slayers]] novels, she is [[Luke (Slayers)|Luke]]'s partner who acts as the cool and rational one. Luke always professes his admiration for her, but she either ignores or doesn't hear him.

[spoiler]Milina is killed, leading Luke to revive the piece of Shabranigdo within him out of rage.[/spoiler]

Sawsbuck is a brown and cream deer-like Pokémon with rhomboid ears and darker ear insides. Its eyes have light-orange markings that curve down to sides of its face. It has a dark-brown nose, and it sports cream fur on its chin and sides of its face. 

Appears in four different forms, depending on the in-game season:

Fuu wields the element of wind for healing and defensive moves, and pilots the Mashin [[Windam (Rayearth)|Windam]].

title: unfezant
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #521 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Normal/Flying Pokémon.
Unfezant is a Pokémon resembling a gamebird. It is primarily dark gray with lighter gray markings. The light gray markings consist of a heart-shaped patch covering its face and throat, two patches divided by a lacy line on its wings, and intricate stripes with dark rimming on its tail feather. Its beak and eyes are yellow, and it has light gray legs with three clawed toes and a spur on the ankle.
The male Unfezant has a reddish pink, wattle around its eyes. Long, ribbon-like growths from the wattle extend over its head and down past its shoulders.

* [[Unfezant (male)]]
* [[Unfezant (female)]]

It evolves from [[Tranquill]].
Japanese Name: [b]Kenhallow[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Tranquill]]
Next Pokémon: [[Blitzle]]

title: frillish
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #592 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Water/Ghost Pokémon.
Frillish is a jellyfish-like Pokémon resembling young royalty. Regardless of gender, it has a round head with a crown-like tuft, and five tentacle-like appendages. It has oval eyes with white pupils, and a collar around its neck. As a male Frillish, it is blue, with smooth appendages and a triangular crown. It has red eyes with blue sclera and a straight eyelash on each eye, its collar is wavy, and it appears to be frowning. As a female Frillish, it is pink, with wavy appendages and a round crown. It has blue eyes with red sclera and a curled eyelash on each eye, its collar is frilled, and it appears to be smiling.

Genders:

* [[Frillish (male)]]
* [[Frillish (female)]]

It evolves into [[Jellicent]]
Japanese Name: [b]Pururill[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Amoonguss]]
Next Pokémon: [[Jellicent]]

title: jellicent
body:
[[pokemon|Pokémon]] #593 in the National PokéDex, a dual type Water/Ghost Pokémon.
Jellicent is a large jellyfish-like Pokémon whose appearance varies based on gender. Both genders have five tentacles, two of which are long with petal-shaped ends. The remaining three are short and tapered. A male is blue with a short, white crown, and a white, moustache-like collar. Its eyes are red with blue sclera, and there is one eyelash over each eye. Its long tentacles have white edges, while its short tentacles have white spots. A female is pink with a tall, white crown and a puffy, white collar. Its eyes are blue with red sclera and surrounded by two eyelashes. Its mouth is red and heart-shaped. The long tentacles have white edges like the male, but the short ones have white frills.

Genders:

* [[Jellicent (male)]]
* [[Jellicent (female)]]

It evolves from [[Frillish]].
Japanese Name: [b]Burungel[/b]

title: gold_digger
body: Comic book series created by Fred Perry (not the tennis player), published by Antarctic Press since 1991.  At its core are the adventures of archeologist/super-scientist Gina Diggers and her adopted sister Britanny, the last of Earth's full-blooded were-cheetahs, but it has a vast supporting cast as well. body:

Castform is an artificial Pokémon that changes appearance and attitude based on the weather. Its body is made of cells exactly like those of water molecules, causing its cellular structure to be altered by temperature and humidity.

It can change form and its type depending on weather conditions:

* [[Castform (normal)]] - no weather conditions

* [[Castform (snowy)]] - during snow
* [[Castform (sunny)]] - during harsh sunlight

title: meowstic
body:
[[Pokemon]] #678 in the National PokéDex, a Psychic-type Pokémon.  

It evolves from [[Espurr]] starting at level 25. 

Meowstic's appearance differs drastically between genders, but in either form, it is a bipedal feline Pokémon with a humanlike posture, digitless appendages, and two tails.

Gender tags:

* [[Meowstic (male)]]
* [[Meowstic (female)]]

The male's fur is predominantly dark blue with accentuations of white, while the female's color scheme is reversed. The male's ears are mostly blue with some accents of white, and the tips are pointed straight; the female's ears are entirely white, and the tips are curled. The tuft of fur between the male's ears is white and in a straight, diagonal style; the female's tuft is blue and curled. The collar of fur around the male's neck is white and in a pointy style, while the female's collar is blue with a curl rising up to its face. The male's eyes are spring green with darker green pupils, while the female's eyes are yellow with red pupils. The male's tails each have a white stripe just before ending in white, while the tails themselves end in a point; the female's tails are blue at the base and end in white fluffy curls.

Japanese Name: [b]Nyaonix[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Espurr]]
Next Pokémon: [[Honedge]]

title: katou_asuka
body:
One of [[Kuroki Tomoko]]'s classmates in her second and third year, Asuka is one of the popular girls in class. She has a keen interest in cosmetics and fashion.

She is friends of both [[Okada Akane]] and [[Nemoto Hina]] in her own class. Her friends from other classes are [[Sasaki Fuuka]], [[Narita Miho]], and [[Kusunoki Kaho]].

Was called "class mom" by Tomoko, hence her fan nickname. Currently Tomoko's rather obvious crush.

title: sasaki_fuuka

title: oricorio
body:
[[Pokemon|Pokémon]] #741 in the National PokéDex. Its type depends on its current form:
If [i]Red Nectar[/i] is used on Oricorio, it will change into [i]Baile Style[/i], where it becomes Fire/Flying-type.
In its Baile Style, native to Ula'ula Island, Oricorio is covered in red feathers with two lines of black feathers across each of its wings and tail. 

If [i]Yellow Nectar[/i] is used on Oricorio, it will change into [i]Pom-Pom Style[/i], where it becomes Electric/Flying-type.
In its Pom-Pom Style, native to Melemele Island, Oricorio is primarily yellow. Most of its body is pale yellow with a line of longer feathers around its waist like a skirt. 

If [i]Pink Nectar[/i] is used on Oricorio, it will change into [i]Pa'u Style[/i], where it becomes Psychic/Flying-type.
In its Pa'u Style, native to Akala Island, Oricorio has pink feathers. Its main body is a dark pink, while most of its other feathers are varying shades of pink.

If [i]Purple Nectar[/i] is used on Oricorio, it will change into [i]Sensu Style[/i], where it becomes Ghost/Flying-type.
In its Sensu Style, native to Poni Island, Oricorio's feathers are mainly purple. The tips of its wings broaden into a fan shape, and it has a fan-shaped crest on top of its head. 


It does not evolve from or into another Pokémon.

Japanese Name: [b]Odoridori[/b]

Prior Pokémon: [[Crabominable]]
Next Pokémon: [[Cutiefly]]

h5. Styles

* [[Oricorio (Baile)]]
* [[Oricorio (Pa'u)]]
* [[Oricorio (Pom-Pom)]]
* [[Oricorio (Sensu)]]

title: gas_mask_canister
body: A watertight metal canister in which German soldiers during World War II carried their standard-issue gas masks.  Or at least they were supposed to carry their gas masks in them.  In practice, they tended to stash anything they wanted to keep dry in there, since poison gas was rarely if ever a problem on the battlefields of World War II.

title: neon_genesis_evangelion_gakuen_datenroku
body:
[b][i]Neon Genesis Evangelion: Campus Apocalypse[/i][/b] (新世紀エヴァンゲリオン 学園堕天録, Shin Seiki Evangerion Gakuen Datenroku, literally "New Century Evangelion: Campus of Fallen Heaven's Record") is a spin-off manga series written and drawn by [[Ming Ming (mangaka)|Ming-Ming]] (眠民).

The story follows the characters from [[Neon Genesis Evangelion]] in an alternate reality version of their battles against the Angels, who are presented this time in humanoid form. The Children – [[Ikari Shinji]], [[Ayanami Rei]] and [[Souryuu Asuka Langley|Soryu Asuka Langley]] – attend the NERV Foundation Academy, a religious school that is a front for the war against the Angels. Shinji gets drawn into the war after he witnesses transfer student [[Nagisa Kaworu]] battling an Angel alongside Rei.

[i]Campus Apocalypse[/i] was first serialized by Kadokawa Shoten between 2007 and 2009 in the [i]shōjo[/i] magazine [i]Monthly Asuka[/i], and was later compiled into four [i]tankōbon[/i] volumes. The series was published in trade paperback form the U.S. by Dark Horse Comics between September 2010 and June 2011.

title: prince_of_samantoria
body:
One of the two male player characters in [[Dragon Quest II]]. In english translations, "Samantoria", "Sumaltria" or whatever has been changed into "Cannock".

His name was random in the original game, chosen from a small pool of names. One particular name in the japanese version ([b]"Tonnura"[/b]) became a sort of in-joke due to sounding "odd and stupid" to Japanese people. This, coupled with him being the weakest of the trio in the original versions of the game, has given a sort of impact in future games.

As mentioned, he is the weakest of the trio in the original Famicom/NES versions, due to being unable to use late-game equipment (His strongest equipment is equivalent to [[prince_of_lorasia|Lorasia/Midenhall]]'s [i]mid-game[/i] equipment). Remakes of the game rebalances him by giving him access to more gear, making him a potent fighter-mage.

title: dempsey_roll
body:
A [[boxing]] technique developed and used by American boxer Jack Dempsey. It is also known as the signature move of [[Makunouchi Ippo]] from [[Hajime no Ippo]]. 


To use this technique, the user lowers his/her stance and central balance and begins to aggressively weave his/her body in a pattern similar to the shape of a side way figure eight or infinity symbol. He/she then fires a series of rapidly executed [[punching|punches]] from both left and right angles whilst continuing his/her bobbing and weaving.

title: tankard
body:
A type of [[cup|drinking vessel]] with a handle and possibly a hinged lid. They are usually made of wooden staves, like a small [[barrel]], but some tankards may be made of metal or ceramic. The traditional [b]beer stein[/b] may be thought of as a highly ornamental type of tankard.

Due to the nostalgic design of tankards, they are commonly seen in medieval European [[fantasy]] settings, particularly in [[tavern|taverns]].

h4.See also
* [[mug]]
** [[beer mug]]

title: hentatsu
body:
A series of shorts, each being anywhere between half a minute to two minutes long, released by [[irodori (irodoriginal)|irodori]], originally between January and July of 2018 (consisting of 7 shorts), and August and September of 2019 (consisting of 2 shorts). It follows two girls - one who's a black-haired [[oni_(hentatsu)|oni]] (voiced by Takasugi Kaoru) and another who's pink-haired, wears glasses and has [[neko_(hentatsu)|cat ears]] (voiced by [[Kadowaki Mai]]) - as they discuss a variety of things.

Following a teaser on the 28th of December (announcing that something was to be aired on four different channels on the 4th of January, 2020 at 23:57), it was revealed on the 4th that Hentatsu would be airing a new set of shorts on TV, the shorts being shortly after being uploaded to Twitter and YouTube. 

During the original web shorts, the two girls remained unnamed, though Kadowaki referred to her character as 猫さん (neko-san/cat). With the TV shorts, the official website made for them merely refers to them as "Oni" and "Neko" respectively.

Fans theorize that the oni girl represents [[tatsuki_(irodori)|irodori]]'s [[tatsuki_(person)|Tatsuki]], while the cat-eared girl represents [[Isa Yoshihisa]], another member of irodori. Isa is credited in irodori's works as 平安, which is usually pronounced Heian, but is pronounced Hen in Okinawa; Isa being an Okinawan family name. This would make the title of the series a combination of Hen and Tatsuki's names.

h4. External links

* "Official combined version of first 7 shorts on YouTube":https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VEe7tIET-W8
** "Hentatsu Short 8":https://twitter.com/irodori7/status/1157600375546888193
** "Hentatsu Short 9":https://twitter.com/irodori7/status/1172516800325488640
* "Official TV website":https://hentatsu.com/
* Pre-TV verification of voice actresses: "Takasugi Kaoru":[https://twitter.com/g_ruuu/status/958947434108825600] and "Kadowaki Mai":[https://twitter.com/kadomaita/status/958934385851432961]

body:
Homura Kogetsu (ホムラ・コウゲツ Homura Kōgetsu) is a swordswoman and female knight from the Planet Oedo. She is a member of Edens Zero's crew.
